hint.text: If the product of all terms results in the original expression, then they are all considered to be factors. (They need not be irreducible in this case)

solution.text:
• \( _{{2*k}}_ \times (ab) \times c\) is correct because \( _{{2*k}}_ \times (ab)\times c = _{{2*k}}_abc\)
  • \( \frac {_{{2*k}}_}2 \times 2ab \times c\) is correct because \( \frac {_{{2*k}}_}2 \times 2ab \times c = _{{2*k}}_abc\) [Numerator and denominator are multiplied by the same number, i.e.\(2\)]
  • \( _{{2*k}}_ \times a \times b \times c\) is correct because \( _{{2*k}}_ \times a \times b \times c = _{{2*k}}_abc\) [Irreducible form of \(_{{2*k}}_abc\)]
  • \(1 \times _{{2*k}}_ \times a \times b \times c\) is correct because \( 1 \times _{{2*k}}_ \times a \times b \times c = _{{2*k}}_abc\)

content.text: The term \(_{{2*k}}_abc\) expressed as a product of its factors is :
